page.title: 14CUSTOMS
page.content: The Crawford and Lindsay families give great patronage to the annual village flower show. This is a large competitive Flower, Horticultural and Homecraft Show, very reflective of the interests and hobbies pursued in a close, rural community. On 31st October, the children keep up the custom of dressing up in 'disguise' to go "Guising".They knock on doors and offer a song or a poem,hoping to be rewarded with nuts, apples or even money. Hogmanay is the last night of any year. After midnight people call on friends and neighbours to wish them a Happy New Year. It is unlucky to go into a house empty-handed.
